1533322222221211.content:
As you slowly begin to open your eyes from the sudden knock out, a brief headache manages to rattle on inside your cranium. "Ahh..." you groan lifting both hands up to gently caress the temples on both sides of your forehead. "what happened?" you murmur, completely clueless as to just what occured earlier. As you soon begin to gaze upon your surroundings, to your surprise everything seemed completely alien around you. "Huh?" you stammer gazing at the odd greenery all about your area. "What kind of plant is that?" you murmur, never before seeing the odd green vegetation before you. Upon gazing upwards, a familiar yet odd sight soon befell you. "Wait a minute..." you stutter. "that looks like the flower I just planted...two days ago." The colors and shapes of the petals were without a doubt the very same as you remembered, the only problem was just how tall and massive it was compared to you. "W-wait a minute!" you gasp suddenly piecing the puzzle together. "I-I shrunk!?"

Several emotions begin to jumble inside you over your sudden predicament. Fear, confusion and disbelief stormed about in your mind in a furious fashion as you desperately sought an explanation for such an event. As you stand still trying to gather as much available clues towards your shrinking, a sudden loud tremor manages to snap you back to reality. "W-what was that!?" you think aloud.

Quickly, your head begins to scan about the area trying to find the source of said sounds, and to your ultimate surprise the source was quickly approaching you. "N-No way." you murmur under your breath as your lower jaw immediately drops down in an agape state. Standing a few yards away was none other than Skye, your aquamarine wolfess neighbor.

"Hmmmm..." you manage to hear her voice emanate from high above. "I could've sworn I saw bugs here earlier..." she mutters as she rests her massive sized catching net on her shoulder.

The sight of the massive wolfess completely catches you off guard as you do nothing but stare at her with wide eyes for a brief few seconds. As soon as reality slapped you back on the face, you quickly shook your head while desperately thinking of a plan. Skye was always nice and friendly towards you. Perhaps, she might be able to help you with your little problem? Besides, knowing her she'd never harm a fly...or at least that's what you thought based on all the times you've seen her outside.

With a deep breath, you sshakily begin to walk up towards her huge left paw before taking a deep breath. Immediately, you cup both hands around your mouth before shouting at the top of your lungs. "SKYE!"

"Huh!?" The huge wolfess stammers as her ears wiggled slightly. "w-what was that?" she mutters as she quickly begins to turn her head about helplessly confused.

"Yes!" you beam while clenching your fist in a victorious manner. Looks like her pointed ears truly are good for listening. With her gazing about, now seemed like the perfect chance to get her attention below. "SKYE!" you call out once more as the light blue wolfess's eyes quickly trail downwards before gasping.

"Oh my gosh!" she gasps before covering her mouth in sheer surprise. "Is that- "
1533322222221211.title: Sounds like an interesting idea

He gives a weak yet small reassuring smile, which means good intentions.
1533322222221221.content:
What shook you awake was the whirlwind of aromas that invaded your nose, immediately making you sit right up, gasping. You could barely see, the light blinding you as you try to stand up. From what it felt like, you woke up on the carpet, and you just assumed you must of accidentally rolled out of your bed.

Oh how you wished that was the case. It was only a good 4-5 seconds before your eyesight adjusted, and you froze, eyes wider than saucers as you scanned the area. Problem one was; this wasn't your bedroom. Problem two was; this was the rather reclusive and older wolf Wolfgang's home. and Problem three was; everything was gigantic. Or maybe, he was the one that was lacking in size. As you sniffed the air, you immediately pulled back, groaning in disgust. It was the rancid smell of alcohol, which slightly gave you a burning sensation in your nose. Now that you look around, his modern home was pretty poorly taken care of.

From what you could see from your level, there were beer bottles and trash scattered across the corners of the room, what looked like an ashtray with several cigarettes butts rested on the distant coffee table, dusty old paintings that you've heard rumors of being made by the wolf himself, and even some adult magazines with a few wadded up tissues. Finally, your eyes came to the couch, where the snoring wolf rested. He was just as huge as everything else, which incredibly intimidated you. Wolfgang was already relatively scary when you were normal sized, but now? You were locked in the same house with this beast, being only a good 3 inches high.

You knew there would be no way out of here, other than through the old wolf. Sighing to yourself, you trekked over to his slumbering body. Fortunately for you, one of his paws had rolled off the couch, it resting on the ground as he laid sprawled out on the couch. His snores nearly shook you, but you needed to get him awake. Carefully grabbing at his fingers, you pull and shake them, but he doesn't even seem to budge. That's when you give them a bite, not hard enough to break the skin, but enough to hopefully wake him up.

You managed to succeed, the snoring cutting short as the wolf lazily opened up his eyes, blinking several times. He yawned out, and immediately looked down at the paw you were still pulling on. You could feel his eyes on you, making you shiver in fear and hope, slowly looking up at him.

"Huh? The hell?" He muttered, his paw quickly wrapping around you to pull you closer to his face. You winced and trembled at the quick change in altitude, as you stared up at him, wondering if this was a good idea. You started to shrink back when those large eyes stared you down, scanning over your form.

"Hey, you're the mayor, right? The guy that just got put in charge not that long ago? Why the hell are you so damn small? And why are you in here?" He spoke, almost accusingly. You wipe your brow, before trying to explain as calmly as possible you have no idea, and that you woke up here, and that you need his help.

Wolfgang was fully awake now, standing up from the couch with his free paw in a fist on his hip, while the other held you in place up to his face, obviously thinking out the situation. It felt intimidating, but you had to hope he'd be of help. Holding your breath, you looked up at him, trying to read his expression for an answer.

1533322222222111.content:
You couldn't mistake the strange design of the house when you came to. The strange, fake sand that's scattered around the house, the hieroglyphics on the wall, the weird pyramids in the middle of the house? Despite it all towering far, far above you, you could easily recognize the place as Lucky's house. Of course, the furniture you've let him have is around too, the desk and chair, the fridge, and even a bed has replaced his unsettling dingaloids, and that weird Sphinx. Unfortunately though, it looked like the mysterious yet adorable dog was out. You figured your best bet was to get some high ground, so you could survey the area, and hopefully get Lucky's attention when he returns.

It took a bit of a hike, but you found your way to Lucky's desk, and started to climb up the chair. Shimmying up the metal leg wasn't as difficult as you thought it was. Maybe all that working out you've done with Rowan was starting to pay off? Your thoughts of your tiger friend are interrupted as you reach the top of the seat, and are suddenly startled by the door opening. It was Lucky himself, humming a cute little tune as he waltzed into his house with a bag of groceries close to his belly. You waved and jumped up and down from the seat, but it didn't look like he noticed you. Unfortunately for you, Lucky's always been a bit lightheaded, and oblivious. You've spent plenty of time with your friend Lucky. You're one of the few people to know that he's not actually a mummy, or actually even hurt. He just wears those bandages because of both his addiction to Egyptian stuff, and that he thinks it's "super cool".

He set the groceries on top of the desk, and opened up the fridge, putting in his new groceries one at a time, till all that was left was a tasty looking sub. You couldn't really see it that well from your position, but you could hear Lucky's stomach groaning in excitement for it. When Lucky closed his fridge with a smile, he immediately turned his attention to the desk. You took your chances to try and jump and wave your arms at him again, but that submarine sandwich was too enticing for the canine. Unfortunately for you though, you were so focused on trying to flag Lucky down from that seat, you didn't even realize when he turned around, his jet black furred bottom was descending towards you quickly. You froze up, staring up at in both shock and almost admiration. It's still cute, even if it's bigger than you and coming dangerously close to crushing you under it. Can you react quick enough?
1533322222222111.title: Lazy Mummy(?) Dog.

15333222222221112.content:
You narrowly manage to avoid being squished under the weight of your air-headed friend, jumping successfully to the left. With a shake and nearly a boom, Lucky's gigantic body plopped right on the wooden chair, making you nearly bounce in the air. You manage to keep your bearings though after giving your head a quick shake. You then gaze up at Lucky right between his thighs.

He obviously wasn't even aware of you right now, his eyes dead ahead on his sandwich. You could even hear him lick his lips as he almost comically started to tie a napkin around his neck like a makeshift bib. You didn't even think people did that, but you guess your friend picked it up from all those cartoons he watches, despite his age.

You sigh and look over your options. There isn't much you can do from your position, except...

You stare dead ahead, at the slight protruding bulge right in front of you. His bandages were adjusted improperly, carefully covering his cock, but from earlier it seemed to be a little too lose to cover his ass. It felt embarrassing to think about messing with it. You could tell it wasn't huge for average standards, but compared to you? It was way bigger than your body, almost intimidating, yet still cute.

You are just about to approach it, hand outreached till you hear a slap to your side. Lucky had rested a paw on his own thigh, opening up a new opportunity for you. Seeing it, you start to realize that at least you wouldn't have to deal with the initial embarrassment of Lucky discovering you fiddling with his junk, but you can't guarantee your own safety clinging to his hand while he eats, you could end up falling to the desk, or worse, right into Lucky's sandwich if you don't get his attention.

You took a moment to decide, then immediately...

1533322222222121.content:
At long last, you return to your senses. You'd blacked out a while ago, apparently, and when you look around now, you realize that things are definitely different...

Grass and flowers rise way too tall around you, while trees look like skyscrapers. Somehow, you've shrunk! But how, and why? You look around, and don't see anybody around. You can't figure out how small you are. But you presume you're no more than a few inches tall, judging by the flowers nearby and their height compared to yours.

You're standing there, lost in thought and unsure of what to do, when you hear loud steps approaching. The ground shakes slightly too. You gulp and look around for the source. Something big is coming...

Finally, you see it. Or rather, her. A huge anthropomorphic dog, covered in yellow fur with beige spots. She wears a yellow shirt with stripes of green and orange, and a white skirt beneath it. Her brown eyes glance about as she walks along, bug catching net over her shoulder.

You stare up at the enormous humanoid canine creature, recognizing her as Goldie, a kind dog girl from your town. Thinking quickly, you dive down and hide under the nearest flower bunch, hoping she won't see you. But as you hide, you start to wonder if she might actually be able to help you...
1533322222222121.title: Goldie appears

choices: Yes! Looks like you'll get to know her real well...
15333222222221211.content:
You decide to stay hidden, since being spotted by a gigantic dog girl might not be very safe. After all, she could easily mistake you for a bug at your size, seeing as you are just a few inches tall. So, you stay put and simply watch as Goldie walks by, examining the trees and bushes for bugs to catch. Unfortunately, she seems to be staying in this one area, meaning you'll gave to stay out for a while.

Or rather, you would if the scorpion didn't find you.

You hear scuttling behind you, and turn to see a huge scorpion. Well, huge is relative considering your size, but even if you were normal sized, the thing would probably still be massive. Most scorpions you have caught before are around six inches long, but this one is several times your length. That means ever you're smaller than you thought, or this is one monster of an arachnid. You consider that perhaps this beast is a female. As female scorpions are bigger than males. You decide to roll with that theory, as you tank it's impossible for a scorpion to be this big and yet be of the more diminutive sex.

The scorpion, its (or her as you presume) dull red armor making the arachnid stand out from the plants around, slowly approaches you, stinger tail curled overhead. You stare at the stinger, noting that at this size it could easily pierce right through you. But then again, you recall, that scorpions around here tend to act docile unless threatened. And this (presumably female) scorpion had yet to attack. If you don't act aggressive, she probably won't attack you. Right?

The scorpion approaches you, and comes close enough for her pincers to reach you. You still focus on the tail, though, prepared to try to dodge should the arachnid suddenly attack. Unfortunately that's not what you should be focusing on.

The scorpion's left pincer shoots forward in the blink of an eye, its two halves snapping shut around your waist. You look down in shock, and witness the second pincer clamp around your chest. The two pincers squeeze you painfully, keeping a very tight grip on you. You begin to shout and squirm, struggling in the grasp of the enormous arachnid as she easily lifts you off the ground and brings you to her. You're held so close to her bizarre insectoid face that you're almost touching it. You notice the creature seems to be examining you closely, and you're shocked at the fact that she hasn't stung you yet. Or pinched you into pieces, at least. After all, you are in her grasp, completely powerless.

It's a weird situation to be sure--ordinarily, you would be the one catching these creatures, but now, you are the one caught in the scorpion's clutches, and she doesn't show any signs of letting you go. In fact, she begins to walk back into the cover of plants, carrying you with her.

You can't believe it. You're being taken hostage by a scorpion.

You stop struggling. It's no sure. The scorpion has you, and isn't letting you go. The question is, are you doomed to be in her grasp?
15333222222221211.title: Suddenly, scorpion!

choices: She still thinks you're a bug! Apparently her eyesight stinks...
15333222222221212.content:
The canine giantess is intimidating at her size, but you remember talking with her plenty of times before. She's really quite gentle and even a little shy when you get to know her. Surely she wouldn't hurt you, even at your tiny size. Right?

Trusting in this hope, you step out from under the flowers and yell Goldie's name. The dog doesn't seem to notice, and keeps walking. You hurry to get in her path, wondering if it's a bad idea to stand in the way of a giant creature many times your size, but you keep shouting anyway.

Finally, you notice Goldie's eyes lock on to you, her gaze at last falling on you. Her mouth opened slightly as she gasps in shock...

... And she quickly raises the bug net, apparently mistaking you for a bug. You run to the side, narrowly avoiding being caught as the dog leans into the swing, the net hitting the ground and missing you. You turn to Goldie and keep shouting, telling her to stop...
15333222222221212.title: Show yourself

choices: You run into another animal villager along the way
You make it to Goldie's house without incident
153332222222212122.content:
Finally, it seems your shouts reach her. Goldie stares at you intently before letting out a surprised shout and dropping her net, raising her paw-hands to her chest in shock. After a few moments, she gets down on her paw-hands and knees, bringing her face frighteningly close to you. You stumble back at the sight, looking into giant brown eyes at least the size of your head.

"M-Mayor?" Goldie stammers. Her voice is quite loud considering her size, but she seems to be trying to stay quiet. "How... How did you get so small?"

You shrug and tell her that you just woke up like this. Goldie frowns.

"Really?" she asks. "Well, that's... Weird. I've heard stories of Famous Mushrooms making some animals grow... But I've never heard of anybody shrinking before. Are you okay?"

You nod, and Goldie sighs in relief.

"Okay, that's good, at least. Well, looks like we need to find out how to return you to normal. You know... Maybe I have a book that can help us! Say, let's go to my house! How about right now?"

Before you can respond, Goldie reaches out with her left hand-paw. You're too surprised to move as the digits spread and clamp around your tiny body tightly, holding you in a firm (and furry) grasp. Goldie stands up tall as she lifts you off the ground, showing no effort in lifting your tiny form. You're surprised at how easily you can be moved at this size. It's a bit scary, but only makes you more motivated to return to normal.

Goldie smiles gently at you, reminding you that she means you no harm, and goes over to grab her bug net before hurrying towards her house, clutching you closely to her chest.
153332222222212122.title: She recognizes you

choices: "Go talk to Bianca. She's friendly. She'll help us!"
"Stay hidden. She'd get way too excited to see me and she might hurt me..."
1533322222222121221.content:
Goldie hurries through the town, following the worn dirt paths towards her house, passing between trees and past bushes and flowers as she walks through a more heavily forested part of town. You're jostled in her grasp as her hand-paw bounces with each step, and you start to feel a little sick. But you remain quiet, not sure if the giantess holding you could even hear you should you speak up. So, you just do your best to enjoy the ride, hoping nothing bad happens.

And then something potentially bad does happen. You notice another anthropomorphic animal come out from around a group of trees right in Goldie's path, and the dog stops in her tracks at the sight. The animal is a white furred tiger girl, whom you recognize as the peppy Bianca. She wears a red dress, and appears to be taking a stroll through the woods.

"Oh, shoot," Goldie says. Quickly, she hurries behind a nearby tree, crouching down and panting. After a few moments, she brings you up to her huge face and speaks again.

"She still hasn't seen us... I don't know if we should let her spot you, Mayor. She might be able to help you, but... Maybe it would be best to keep you secret. What do you think?"

In response, you say...
1533322222222121221.title: You run into another animal villager along the way

15333222222221212211.content:
Goldie frowns, but nods. She seems to not trust Bianca for some reason, but chooses to follow your suggestion.

The dog girl holding you rises from her hiding spot and steps out onto the path. Bianca spots her, and waves before bounding down the path towards her. She stops a few feet away, though, her bright blue eyes aimed directly at you. You shiver despite the body heat of Goldie's fist warming you. Seeing a humanoid tigress many times your size staring at you makes you nervous.

"Uh... Goldie," she begins. "Is that the Mayor?"

Goldie nods. "Yes, Bianca. I found him like this just a little ways away. We don't know how he got like this,"

Bianca takes a few steps forward, her eyes still on you. You feel Goldie tighten her grip on you. Seems like she's becoming a bit protective of you.

"He... He looks... So..."

Suddenly, Bianca lets out a loud squeal, her eyes literally sparkling as she brings her hand-paws up to her cheeks..

"...ADORABLE!"

She keeps staring at you, grinning widely as Goldie stares confusedly at her.

"Bianca... Please, calm down," she says.

"I can't!" the tigress replies. "He's too cute! Can I keep him?"

You look at Bianca with a shocked expression, surprised that she would even think about keeping another sentient being as a pet. You look up at Goldie, and see her expression is...
15333222222221212211.title: "Go talk to Bianca. She'll help us!"

choices: You make it to her home safely
You suffer another encounter along the way
153332222222212122111.content:
"No!"

With a shout, Goldie brings up her other hand-paw and clasps it around the one holding you, creating an even tiger grasp as she holds you closely to her chest. "No!" she shouts again. "He's not a pet! In fact, I'm trying to help him return to normal. Like a good friend would do!"

This seems to affect Bianca, and her eyes drop. Her ears droop as a frown crosses her face.

"I... I'm sorry," she says. "I just... Just lost control for a moment. I wouldn't really keep the Mayor as a pet! That's just wrong! I know that!"

"Good," Goldie says, her grip on you loosening slightly as she perceives the threat of Bianca to be passing. "Now, listen up. I was heading back home to see if any of my books have a solution to the Mayor's little shrinking problem. Do you want to help me solve this?"

Bianca shrugs. "I dunno what I could do."

"You own some books, right?"

"Do fashion magazines count?"

"...no, Bianca, they do not. But if you think you have anything at all that can help us return the Mayor to normal... Get it and bring it to my house. Okay?"

Bianca nods, and runs off through the woods towards her house. Goldie sighs, and brings you up to her face again, returning you to just one hand-paw.

Then, to your disgust, she licks you.

Her tongue slips from between her lips and presses into your face, coating it in drool as it slides along it. You cough and splutter, shocked that Goldie would do such a thing. You look up at her, but see that her face is very gentle, her eyebrows angled up as a smile appears on her face. Apparently, that was a lick of affection. Still a bit weird coming from an anthropomorphic dog, though.

"Don't worry, Mayor," she says. "I'll get you back to normal. I promise."

With that, she hurries down the path, following Bianca back to where the town's houses are gathered.
153332222222212122111.title: Angry dog

choices: There's a knock on the door
Goldie jumps up with a triumphant shout
1533322222222121221111.content:
Goldie makes it out of the woods and into a treeless patch of land where most of the town's houses are located. You note how everything looks mostly the same despite your small size, but you attribute that to being held several feet off the ground in the paws of a giantess, which gives you a vantage point similar to your normal height. Goldie eventually makes it back to her house, and fumbles with her keys with the paw not holding you until she finally manages to unlock the door. She steps inside, locking the door behind her and hitting the lights, illuminating the interior of her house.

You take in the combination of minimalist and wooden furniture, along with the wooden walls and rug that is the same color combo as her shirt. You haven't been in her house many times before, and at your new size the experience is even more new to you. She walks to the back right corner of the house, setting you atop a bookcase and pulling up a wooden stool and sitting down to get at eye level with you.

"Alright, we're home," she says. "Out of curiosity, do you like the decor?"

You decide it's best to stay on her good side, seeing as she's big enough to squish you like a bug, so you nod. She grins in response, and nods back.

"Glad to hear it! Anyway, we really ought to get on to business." She begins browsing the bookshelf you're standing on, picking out several books and putting them on the bed a few steps away, in the left back corner of the house. You watch her, intrigued by the movements of such a massive creature for a bit, but are snapped out of it when Goldie comes back over and sits before you again. She glances back at the door before looking at you.

"I wonder if Bianca will show up," she murmurs. "I guess I should just get started on my reading for now. I'll leave you here, if that's okay with you."

You nod, and she smiles back. "Great! Just yell if you need anything."

With that, she stands up and heads towards her bed, stopping by the turntable to turn it on and start playing a popular song you don't quite remember the title of before lying down on the bed and grabbing a book, flipping through it quickly. You sit down, looking around Goldie's house again and marveling at the unique perspective you have of it.

It seems to engross you enough that you don't notice the passage of time. In what seems like no time at all...
1533322222222121221111.title: Goldie's house

choices: Another animal appears at the window, spotting the three of you
15333222222221212211111.content:
Suddenly, there's a knock on the door. Goldie gets up off her bed, leaving her books behind, and goes over to the door. You watch as she unlocks it and cracks it open a bit, peeking outside. She steps back an instant later, opening the door and saying "Welcome!" as the white-furred tigress Bianca steps inside, her arms wrapped around a few books clutched to her chest.

Bianca glances around the room before finally spotting you. She grins widely, showing her sharp teeth, which makes you shudder again. Goldie is technically a carnivore too, but she doesn't have as intimidating of a set of teeth as Bianca.

Goldie goes to her bed and sits down, motioning for Bianca to sit on the stool. The tigress places her books on the bed and sits down, but quickly scoots the chair over to the bookshelf you are atop. Goldie keeps examining the books Bianca brought, and doesn't lay the tigress any attention as she approaches you.

"Hey, Mayor!" she says, peppy as ever. You simply say hello back.

"So... Found out anything about your shrinking?"

You shake your head.

"Well, I hope it turns out for you!" she says.

"You're really hoping he turns back to normal?" Goldie asks, somewhat incredulously. "Weren't you just freaking out about how cute he looked earlier?"

"Yeah, I was freaking out. But... Like you said, Goldie, he needs our help. And I'll never let a friend down!"

You smile at that. She sounds sincere.

"So, do my books look any good?" Bianca asks Goldie.

"You have some interesting variety here," the dog replies. "I'm surprised you have this book on... 'magic mushrooms'. They aren't the kind I'm thinking of, are they?"

"Oh, of course not! I mean magic as in literally magic! Like, they can make you look different. They're pretty popular in the fashion world."

"I wonder if any of them can make people rerun to normal size... I remember hearing about Famous Mushrooms having that kind of power... But I think I should read up and see what this book says. We might be on to something here."

With that, Goldie lies down again and begins reading, while Bianca sits on the stool with her elbows on her knees and her hand-paws on her chin. Her blue eyes are locked on to you, and you give a shy wave. The attention is a little unsettling given the size difference.

After staring at you for a while...
15333222222221212211111.title: There's a knock on the door

choices: She begins toying with you some more, and Goldie still doesn't notice
153332222222212122111112.content:
"Hey, Mayor?" Bianca says, seeming somewhat sheepish. "Listen, I was wondering... Could I... Pick you up?"

You stare at her. Kind of an odd question to ask. Then again, you're in an odd situation. You wonder why she wants to hold you, and what she plans to do after she picks you up... But you decide that Bianca seems kind enough to not hurt you. You nod, and she grins widely.

"Oh, thank you, Mayor!" she says happily. "I'll be gentle. I promise!"

She stands up, towering over you, and you look up at the white-furred giantess as she reaches for you with a paw. She's retracted her claws, thankfully, but the enormous paw-shaped hand still makes you a little scared. In it, you're completely powerless after all.

The hand-paw reaches you, fingers and thumb curling around you from the chest down. You didn't think ahead enough to raise your arms so they could not be pinned, but it's too late now. Bianca's grip tightens as she slowly lifts you off the bookshelf and up to her face. You're brought within inches of it, so it takes up your whole view. You observe the white fur, gray markings, and blue eyes with long lashes, while her own eyes cross slightly to stare at you. After a few seconds of mutual staring, she squeezes you slightly, making you grunt. She smiles at that.

"Heh... You're kinda squishy, Mayor," she says, squeezing you again. You begin to squirm in her grasp, not feeling fully comfortable anymore. If she squeezes you too hard... That could be disastrous.

Bianca doesn't release you, though. You're still held tightly in her furry fist, and after a few more moments...
153332222222212122111112.title: Bianca asks you something

1533322222222121222.content:
Goldie makes her way down the dirt path and finally leaves the forested area of town. Luckily, you don't encounter any other giant animal villagers. In no time, she reaches her house. It's a small place, but looms over you intimidatingly at your size. The canine giantess holding you crouches and carefully puts you on the ground, freeing both hand-paws to more easily reach into a pocket and withdraw a key, with which she unlocks the door to her house. She then crouches again, reaching down and gently closing her fist around you before standing up and entering her house, locking the door behind her.

You haven't been in her house often, and take the chance to observe her minimalist and modern wood furnishings. You don't get a chance to examine them too closely, though, because Goldie hurries towards the bookshelf in the back right corner of her house and carefully sets you down on top of it before pulling up a wooden stool and sitting down to get at eye level with you.

"Alright, Mayor, let's get going on how to return you to normal," she says as she browses the books in the shelf you're standing on. She grabs a few, seemingly interested by their titles, and clutches them to her chest as she looks back at you.

"I might have something here," she says before putting the books on her bed and pulling the stool over, sitting down on the stool and reading the books. She doesn't pay you any more mind, and you just look around her house. It's a unique perspective to be just a few inches tall, and you almost enjoy it. But you don't have much time to enjoy your new viewpoint of the world before...
1533322222222121222.title: You make it to Goldie's house without incident

choices: "First option: find a Famous Mushroom and eat that. Shall we try that, or..."
"... we could just wait a couple days. It'll wear off on its own."
15333222222221212221.content:
"Hey, Mayor," Goldie says. You look towards her as she gets up off her bed and comes back over to the bookshelf you're standing on, clutching a single book. "I think I've found something. Remember when I said that I'd heard about Famous Mushrooms making those who ate them grow in size?"

You nod. She did indeed say something like that when she first found you.

"Well, I've found a book that talks about mushrooms, and it says that there's another mushroom that's like the Famous Mushroom. It goes by several names, but most commonly it's referred to as the Mini Mushroom. It's a small blue mushroom with white spots, and supposedly, it makes you shrink--as the name implies. But it's really uncommon. Apparently, it only grows in a faraway kingdom of mushrooms that I've never heard of before. I was thinking... maybe you ate one of those Mini Mushrooms and shrunk? Do you remember ever seeing one?"

She holds up the book, displaying a blue and white cartoony mushroom with two black markings on the stem resembling eyes. It looks vaguely familiar. You shake your head, though. You don't recall eating anything like that before you blacked out and subsequently shrunk. As far as you know, you were just hanging out when you suddenly blacked out and woke up at just a few inches tall. You tell Goldie this, and the canine giantess frowns.

"Oh... Then, I'm not sure how you shrunk if it's not the Mini Mushroom. None of the other books I read had any useful information in them. The Mini Mushroom was all I could find. But.. . this book does give advice for how to reverse the effects of the mini Mushroom. I think we should try them out just to see if they work. Even if you didn't shrink from a Mini Mushroom, it can't hurt to try these suggestions. That being said, there's only two of them, and the second one doesn't sound good..."
15333222222221212221.title: Goldie reads something interesting

15333222222221212222.content:
You keep looking around the house, but start to feel odd... Almost like someone is watching you. You look around quickly, trying to find the source... And there it is.

Or rather, there she is. At the window stands another anthropomorphic animal, and not just any animal. It's your trusty secretary, Isabelle. And her big dark eyes are focused right on you, as her mouth hangs slightly open.

In an instant, she's gone. But then you hear a knock on the door. Goldie sits up in bed, confused as to who is knocking, and gets up to check it out. She opens the door and peeks outside.

"Oh! Isabelle! Good to see you," she says, still not opening the door fully, "what's up?"

"We're going to have a spceremony to celebrate the new bridge that was built yesterday," Isabelle says. "But the maybe isn't anywhere, and I wanted to see if he was in anybody's house,"

"He isn't here," Goldie says. You're a bit surprised she just lied, but then remember she's doing it to keep you hidden until you turn back to normal, so you can stay safe. Unfortunately, Isabelle knows better, having seen you with her own eyes.

"Um... Actually... He is," Isabelle says. "I saw him through the window, and I saw... How... How small he was."

Goldie stumbles back, surprised. She didn't expect Isabelle of all people to spy through people's windows. As she stumbles back, Isabelle steps through the door and walks straight towards you. You stand still as this second canine giantess approaches. She is wearing her summer outfit, with a green vest and white shirt and a blue skirt, plus a red bell ribbon for her hair. The yellow and white furred dog reaches you and crouches, bringing her face close to you.

"Mayor!" she says with a smile. "I'm glad to see you're alright."

There's a real sincerity in her voice, and you can't help but smile back.

"So, I can see you've shrunk somehow... Do you have any idea how? Or how to fix it?"

You shake your head, but Goldie chimes in. "I've been studying how to help him," she says. "I think I'll have an answer soon."

"Phew... That's good," Isabelle says before turning back to you. "Mayor, just remember... If there is anything I can do to help you, even at your current size... I'll do it. Just ask me, okay?"

You nod, glad that your secretary is levelheaded enough to not panic over this situation. To be honest, it's different than how she usually reacts to surprises... Its almost like she is not surprised at all. It makes you a little...

Suspicious.

But you can't think about it anymore, as Isabelle bids you both farewell and says she'll postpone the ceremony until you return to normal. Goldie says goodbye, and Isabelle leaves the house. Goldie sighs and goes back to her bed to keep reading.

"I hope she doesn't tell anyone," she says. "I don't want everyone barging in here to stare at you, Mayor..."

She resumes reading, and you resume waiting...
15333222222221212222.title: Isabelle makes her appearance

You see a photograph of a tiny smiling human, held in the paws of a smiling anthropomorphic cat as they pose for the picture. You raise your eyebrows with interest as Goldie starts talking.

"It looks like you aren't the first human ever to shrink," Goldie says. "This book is a little weird... but it seems to say that there's actually quite a few humans out there who are like you--they shrunk and didn't know how. Is that a common thing for your people?"

You shake your head. Shrinking, you tell her, is not an ordinary ability or occurrence for humans. Or so you think.

"Ah. Interesting. Anyway, this book actually compiles excerpts from some of their writings, which have also been published on some more out-of-the-way parts of the Internet. Problem is, the book doesn't go into detail about how many of them returned to normal, and this book might not even be nonfiction. That being said, a few accounts do show how the shrunken humans returned to normal. Based off these stories, there's a simple way to fix this: eat a Famous Mushroom. But those are rare. We might not find one easily. Even so, do you want to start looking for one now? Or... you could stay here for a bit, and I'll research some more. Maybe I missed something. While I do that, I'll let you just roam around my house if you want. It's up to you."

After consideration, you tell you you want to...

Goldie nods at your response, smiling. "Good. I'm glad you don't want to stay tiny for too long. To tell the truth, I've been kind of nervous since I found you. It's not safe for you to stay small for so long. So, let's get going!"

She replaces the book in her bookshelf and reaches down to you, gently scooping you up into her hand-paw. You get comfortable in her grasp as she raises you up to her chest, walking over to the door and unlocking it again before opening it up, taking the time to lock it again ad pocket the key before walking towards the forested part of town where she found you.

"You've been planting a lot of trees around here, Mayor, and I've seen you cut down a lot too. I've noticed that you've left some stumps behind if they have interesting patterns on them, and replant if they don't."

You look up at Goldie, an incredulous look on your face. You're surprised that she noticed your actions. It's true that you'd been planting and chopping trees to try to find rare markings, since if those are left and not dug up, mushrooms will grow all year around them. Suddenly, it hits you. That's her plan--look for mushrooms near the stumps, since they'll be most common there.

You ask if that's indeed the case, and Goldie nods. "Yeah, I think we'll have more luck searching near stumps rather than just running all over town. Plus, the woods aren't frequented often, so other villagers will be much less likely to see you."

As you enter the forested area and turn the corner around a tree...

"Oh, Mayor! and Goldie! Nice to see you again!" she says.

Her paw wraps around you, fist closing around your tiny body... but incredibly gently, you notice. Apparently, Isabelle's grasp is just like her personality. She lifts you up to her face and, after looking at you for a moment, whispers.

You pause for a moment. It's interesting... but you prefer being normal sized. That's why you decided to find Famous Mushrooms, after all. You tell Isabelle that, and you notice that she looks dejected at your response. Only for a moment, though, but that's enough to makes you tell that something is amiss. Why would she not like you returning to normal? Does she know something you don't?

153332222222212122222122.content:
Isabelle says, "I'm just disappointed. I... I thought making you small would make you happy..."

And then she stops herself, clamping her free hand-paw over her mouth as her eyes widen and her cheeks turn red through her fur. You just stare at her. She just made a mistake, admitting something she didn't want to. Based on what she said... the way she phrased it makes it sound like she shrunk you herself! "I thought making you small would make you happy"... Is she the one who made you shrink to a few inches tall?

Nervously, you ask Isabelle this. She seems to be growing panicked herself, and you can hear her panting behind the hand-paw covering her mouth. You realize that if she were a human, she'd be sweating, since sweating is to humans what panting is to dogs. Therefore, something must be distressing her greatly.

You repeat your question when Isabelle refuses to answer, but after a few seconds, she answers you at last, her panting stopping as she lowers her free hand-paw from in front of her mouth.

"Yes, Mayor, I admit it! I shrunk you! I read a book that showed tiny humans, and... and it got me thinking... I thought you'd like it if you shrunk too!"

Wait, a book that shows tiny humans? That sounds like Goldie's book! Apparently, Isabelle found a copy. You can't think about it too long, though, because she keeps talking, eyes watering.

"If you shrunk, it would be a new experience for you, and I thought you'd like it. Plus, being so small and helpless would make the villagers help you and grow closer to you. I just... wanted you to enjoy it..."

Isabelle resumes panting, fighting back tears as she holds you in front of her face. "But now... it looks like you hate it. You want to turn back to normal... And... It seems like I've done something wrong, and hurt you. And now I'm worried you hate me, and... I..."

She's choked up, and stops talking. You stare in surprise at how emotional she's getting. But to be honest, that's just like Isabelle. She's super friendly, and it makes sense that if she were to learn that she inconvenienced or harmed you by shrinking you, she'll be really upset by it. And to be honest... you have to respect that. The really does care for your safety.

But... is that enough to forgive her?

"Really? You forgive me? Oh, thank you, Mayor!"

You squirm slightly, as Isabelle's grip has become surprisingly tight all of a sudden, but she doesn't seem to notice. After a few seconds of holding you tightly, she raises you up to her face, and you see that while she's still blushing, her eyes are not watering anymore. She's happy again.

"I'm glad you forgive me, Mayor. I'm sorry for shrinking you... I'll make sure to ask you before I do anything like that again. Promise!"

With that, Isabelle stands up and hurries over to Goldie, still holding you in her gentle grasp. In the morning you woke up to a rude awakening as your bed was lifted, you were confused for a moment until it dawned on you: Buck was putting on the sock! Having no choice you made it to the toe area of the sock as the foot entered smelling gross as ever. You gulped as you his under his toes. You frowned as through the fabric you saw he was putting on his jogging shoes, having known him for a long time you knew they could clear a room and now your face was going to be buried in them for hours. You gulped as your world went dark, extremely smelly, and very wet with sweat.

153332222222222222211.content:
You suddenly found yourself inside a dimly lit room. Everything you could see by the fire light in this place was utterly massive to you. It was terrifying yet oddly familiar. Suddenly the ground shook. The shaking grew more and more powerful before a titanic form suddenly looked overhead. You recognized this titan almost immediately, though you were still having trouble believing what you say. Standing tall in his leaped print shirt and shaggy brown fur was Tucker, a mammoth who lived in your town. While he was taller than you, he was never this massive.

You tried to compose yourself. Tucker was always friendly and easygoing. Perhaps he’d help you. Assuming you could get his attention. Looking up at the mammoth you say that he wasn’t wearing anything at all under that shirt of his, getting a clear view of his junk. Suddenly you realized something. You weren’t on the floor, but you were sitting on something positioned above his knees and below his waist. It suddenly dawned on you, you were on his stool. If you don’t get his attention now you might end up getting very intimately acquainted with his silly underside.

You waved your arms and tried calling up to him, praying that he’s hear you or at least just look down. Cursing him for his more primitive choice in home decoration and lighting, you watched as he got closer to the stool.

1541.content:
Awake. You groan as you feel your head throbbing. You had been lying down on the ground, but your surroundings are unfamiliar. A strong scent of leather and oil overwhelms your senses.

The ground below you is soft, long strands of fabric stretch out around you. Pushing yourself upwards you try to figure out where you are. The strands of fabric are red, and as you stand you find yourself sink into them slightly. "Red grass?" You can't think of anywhere in town that red grass exists. Besides, it was the middle of summer.

Your confusion only continued as you looked up to see massive planks of wood stretching far upwards. Your voice catches in your throat as you realize, "A t-table?"

The scent of oiled leather takes hold of your attention again. The scent is familiar, but you can't place it. Until...

Below the table are several canisters of comically large shoe polish, along with several boxes the size of houses with logos scrawled on the side. They read... "Kicks."

Your analysis was complete; you were standing in a football field of a carpet at Kicks, the local shoe store. Having solved the first of your mysteries you hear a click from the front door, and as if to remove all doubt, a large black and white skunk steps into the empty store and closes the door behind them. Kicks, owner of the store Kicks.

Kicks was wearing his signature brown hat and brown suspenders, complete with dark brown boots that thumped heavily against the stone floor of the store as he moved to his workbench at the back of the store. You began to call out to him, but soon stopped as you realize that compared to Kicks you were not much larger than an insect. Even if your voice could carry to his ears, the sound of his boots as they came in contact with the ground were so loud and heavy that you have to steady yourself as they pass. You notice that you stand barely taller than the treads of the colossal brown boots.

As Kicks comes to stop in front of his workbench, you push yourself out from the large coils of red carpet. You realize you'll have to think of something quick or you might have to avoid more than just one pair of boots stomping around the store.
1541.title: Kicks

choices: Rest on the pile of boxes.
15411.content:
You decide that given your circumstances, the floor isn't the best place for you, especially with Kicks stomping around.

Turning to the stacks of shoe polish and shoe boxes stacked behind and around the showroom table you think you can manage a rather tall, but capable climb up to higher ground. "Maybe then I can get someone's attention."

You begin your climb pulling yourself on top of one of the round containers of shoe polish. It takes a bit of effort, but the eventual push upwards allows you to climb the first container. You notice Kicks has begun working on some boots over at his workbench. Not even aware of your struggles as you begin your climb onto the next canister.

A few minutes pass, but the effort pays off as you have made your way to the boxes near the top of the pile. You see the final obstacle between you and the tabletop. There is a small gap between the set of boxes and the table, however relative to your size, the gap and the drop is quite large. Muscles aching and breath short, you wonder if you shouldn't take a moment to allow yourself to rest before attempting the jump.
15411.title: Scale the showroom table.

154111.content:
You notice yourself becoming rather weak. Whether it's your new size or simply the overpowering scent of shoe oil, you need to rest. The jump will take a lot more effort, so it's best you recover from your climb. You can see it's early in the morning from the light coming in the store's large domed windows. You imagine them as skyscrapers shimmering in the big city as you lay down on the cardboard surface for a quick rest. "Just... to catch... my breath...", you whisper as your eyes droop and you fall asleep.

"..."

(THUD)

You awake to a sudden vibration, bouncing your small form against your cardboard bed. After realizing that you were still your same small self, and that the cause of the vibrations were again, Kicks' movements as he moved past you to another table. You see him straighten some displays near the window. The light had become less harsh, so you imagine it's sometime around midday.

As the vibrations slowed once again by Kicks stopping across the room, you balance yourself on the box once again. You feel a little better about being able to jump the gap to the table, and hopefully to someone's attention. As you ready yourself to jump to the table, Kicks begins to move again. You're at a good height, and Kicks is moving really close to you this time. Should you jump to the safety of the table, or should you try and get Kicks' attention from the pile of boxes as he passes?
154111.title: Rest on the pile of boxes.

choices: Your grip holds for the workbench.
1541112.content:
With the chance of hopefully being seen and getting help, you decide it's best to stay where you are as the skunk once again moves close to your position. The gargantuan skunk towers over you as he moves towards the stack of boxes, still unaware of your presence as he adjust a few more displays around the table.

Now is your chance. Bouncing on top of the cardboard and yelling as loud as you can, you attempt to get Kicks' attention. You are positive that this time you won't be looked over. And begin smiling as Kicks' glances over to where you are. You stop jumping and yelling for Kicks' attention as a large white paw raises up and looms overhead.

Your relief quickly turns to panic. Kicks' paw that you thought was coming to your rescue instead dips under the box you're standing on. The box shifts and shakes as it is lifted upwards, Kicks turning his attention back to the display of shoes on the table. The shift in gravity threatens to throw you off onto the brick floor almost immediately as you drop to your hands and knees to stay atop the box.

As you cling to the box, Kicks slips the empty box under his arm intending to use it for his latest creation at his workbench. You, on the other hand are thrown about as the giant skunk adjusts your perch, still unaware of your plight. Your voice still unable to call his attention. You notice the box beginning to tip as you have trouble stopping yourself from slipping forward. Unable to get a grip on the flat surface, you throw yourself towards the white paw, still gripping the side of the box.

You feel weightless as you see an impossibly large drop to the bricked floor below, leaving the cardboard surface. Reaching out, you grab hold of some of the white and black fur on Kicks' arm. Gravity returns to you as your body now dangles precariously from the skunk's arm fur. Luckily for you, it holds, almost thankful for your size at this point. "But if I was any taller, I wouldn't be in this mess.", you grumble.

Kicks has meanwhile moved towards his workbench again. Your stomach drops as you feel your grip on his fur slipping. You can't expect much help from the skunk as you remain unseen. You see the workbench only a few skunk steps away, but each steps shakes you as he moves forward, and you don't know if you can rely on your grip to take you the rest of the way.
1541112.title: Jump for attention.

choices: Try to slide down the suspenders.
15411122.content:
As you had feared, your grip doesn't last. You slip slowly as you notice Kicks' fur is coated with oils, no doubt from shoemaking. Each titanic step shakes you further off the tuft of arm fur until you finally lose your perch.

A sensation of weightlessness returns as you fall downwards. At a normal scale, you were roughly three feet in the air. At your scale, the fall is much further. Air whooshing around your form, you tumble towards the brick floor. In a panic, you clench your eyes shut as the floor fills your vision. Anticipation of hitting the ground is dispersed as Kicks' panted leg collides with you from the side. Kicks was mid-step while you fell, so as he steps forward it offers you the perch you were looking for. You quickly try to grapple to the large length of brown fabric, but each time you grab hold you slow only a little bit before the speed of your fall pulls you away.

With one last attempt, you grab hold of the brown suspenders and pull yourself inwards, trying to grip to the fabric with your whole body to hopefully stop your descent. Slowly, you slide down the fabric and stop a few inches above Kicks' booted foot. Shivering against the rough material of Kicks' suspenders you let out a sigh of relief as Kicks comes to a stop in front of his workbench. Looking up, you can see Kicks deposit the box you had been on onto the large structure as he continues his work. You are left, unbeknown to the giant skunk, clinging to his pant leg. You consider climbing back up to Kicks' arm, but seeing the length of the climb, you decide you need a better option. Peering downwards, you see that you aren't much further from the ground.
15411122.title: You lose your grip, falling.

154111222.content:
You release your grip on the brown fabric. Slowly you begin to slip down the fabric towards the ground. Little by little you let more release from your grip. Peering up, Kicks is still oblivious to your presence, now using his suspenders as a slide. Suddenly, the area around you gets darker.

You notice your mistake almost immediately. Kicks has his suspenders tucked into his large boots. Without realizing, you had begun slipping towards his large booted paw. The lip of the boot is just above you. You reach out to try and pull yourself out, but in doing so you have released your careful grip on the pant leg. Fabric rushes by you as you plunge into a humid darkness.

The musky scent of old leather mixed with the sweat of the active skunk makes it difficult to breathe. As you finish falling down into the boot you hit the top of Kicks' black paw before rolling into a space between him and the boot. You are surprised that the boot is a spacious as it is, again attributing it to your small size. Pushing against the black paw you find that you are able to push against the paw to move a little easier, but the size and weight of the paw prevents you from moving around well.

Not wanting to be in his boot when Kicks decides to move around again, you need to think of a way out. Despite your pushing, you are surprised Kicks still hasn't noticed you and your predicament. You imagine that if you get to a more sensitive point of his paw, you might be able to call attention to yourself that way. Again you push against the black paw, remarking at the softness of the fur in this rough space. Thinking that the most sensitive point would undoubtedly be the tips of Kicks' paw. You push yourself against the inside of the boot as you move towards the front of the boot. The scent of the musk becomes much more present as you move deeper into the boot, your head swimming as you struggle into the front of the boot.

You feel the pressure against you ease off as you reach the front of his paw pads. The paw responds almost immediately to your touch as it begins to shift inside of the boot, pushing against you. You are shoved to the front of the boot as the paw rubs over your form seemingly trying to find out the cause of irritation. Your breath is once again strained as the paw smothers you, easily rolling over and dominating your small frame. Without much to grab onto you find yourself trying to grip onto the paw itself, which works poorly as you are pushed to the base of the boot, squished against the worn insole. Eventually the paw retracts, seemingly satisfied with the inspection of whatever was inside the boot along with it. You think you might be safe to try and climb back out of the boot, but before you can the whole boot begins to shift upwards.
154111222.title: Try to slide down the suspenders.

1541112221.content:
When Kicks had arrived this morning, he spent most of his time preparing his store and stock for another busy day. At least he had hoped it would be. The day was passing by with relatively sleepy ease. Suspecting that the summer heat had probably left people either spending the day at home or at the beach, he had decided now would be the time to do some shoemaking while he was alone.

"Maybe some more sandals, those seem to be selling well," Kicks spoke softly to the empty store. "Or maybe some boots to get ready for the fall season."

He padded along the brick floor, boots tapping quietly against them, moving towards his workbench. Unfinished shoes and boots are scattered along the workspace, on which he promptly and silently got to work on. Kicks had spent most of his life either shinning shoes or making them, so he took a lot of pride in the result he could give to the villagers of the town. His experienced hands finished a pair sporty looking running shoes, and a pair of open-toed sandals before clearing the workbench of any remaining materials. Pleased with his work he moved towards his showroom tables, clearing spaces for the finished footwear before grabbing a box for the first.

As he rounded back to the workbench he gave a little sigh, already a little tired and it was only just midday. The store was still very warm from the summer heat, Kicks beginning to feel some sweat beginning to dampen his paws and seep into the soles of his boots. He tried his best to ignore the sensation of sweat on his paws, but soon found it difficult, as it felt as if the sweat was beginning to pool towards his toes. It made his paws tingle as the sensation moved towards the front of his boot and eventually underneath the paw. Kicks stopped working for a moment to look down at his boot. Nothing seemed out of the ordinary as he peered down at it: no holes and no tears. Yet, as he felt along the inside of the soles, the paw coming into contact with something cool, that moved against him as he dragged it along the base of the boot.

Kicks decided he had better take off the boot to see what was wrong with his boots, having fixed them recently he didn't want to have to make a brand new pair. Bracing himself against the table, he lifted his boot up and pulled it away from his paw, the skunk briefly sniffing at the boot's worn scent before peering inside.

Meanwhile, while Kicks had been removing the boot, you were being shaken around inside. The sudden removal of the paw from the boot left you with no perch to hold yourself against as you tumbled to the opening of the boot. The opening still up too high to reach, you could only hold yourself against the warm insole of the boot as it was tilted in Kicks' paws. The rush of cool air was a welcome relief from the musky warm scent of the skunk's boot, but you remain in your perilous position as the boot was positioned in front of a pair of large eyes, they are deep purple and as you braced yourself against the sole of the boot, they shift down to meet your gaze. As the large purple orbs focus on your small form, you are unsure, and quite afraid of what you are being perceived as if anything at all.
1541112221.title: Kicks removes the boot.

15411122211.content:
Almost a blink later, the skunk's eyes seem to light up in astonishment, his grip tightening around the shoe in complete awe. He opened his maw to speak, but his words failed him, nothing coming out as he just stared right at you. You weren't quite sure how to respond yourself, feeling a little awkward sitting in the giant's shoe. Kicks had to take a moment to come back to his senses, slowly realizing now that the mayor themselves have made their way into his boot. Slowly and gently, he brought the shoe to the table in the store, where he steadily tipped the boot over a bit, allowing you to fall out of it and softly land on the wooden table.

Neither you or Kicks seemed to have any words. You could only look up at him, finally being able to just take in his massive size. He was huge compared to you, the best comparison you could come up with was that he was about the height of a skyscraper. For a minute the Skunk grimaced, finally beginning to speak.

"W-What were you doing in my boot? And why are you so-- puny?"

You didn't really know how to answer those questions, but decided to explain the best you could. Waking up on the carpet, taking a rest on the boxes, trying to climb up him, falling into his boot... You tried not to leave out a single detail. You couldn't really give him a good answer to why you were so small, which only made Kicks more concerned.

"Well, I don't know how you help you get back to normal, Chum. You remember anything weird happening to you?"

You could really only shake your head, not a single thing coming into mind. The only conclusion you could make is that somehow this happened in your sleep. Kicks sighed a little at that, and you could feel the Skunk's hot breath from the table.

"Alright, then. Maybe you oughta stick with me? I'm not gonna hurt you, and I don't really like the idea of letting you run around this tiny, mayor."

You can't help but feel a little relieved when Kicks mentioned he has no ill intent towards you. It was obvious he didn't want to hurt you before, but somehow just hearing that makes you a bit more comfortable. You give a nod at his words, telling him you would feel a bit better being with him. Kicks returned with a bit of a warm smile, holding out his paw for you to climb up on. You immediately do, and almost right away you nearly lose your balance once the paw moves, causing you to fall to your knees and hold onto Kicks' paw-pads.

Kicks' other paw opened up one of his shirt pockets, which he then slowly slides you in, making sure you are kept in a safe place. You could feel his warmth and hear his heart pumping from there, almost feeling kind of soothed and relaxed in the pocket of the skunk. Once you've finally settled in, Kicks buttons the pocket shut, keeping you inside as you have no choice but to wait.

Kicks begins to move again to..
15411122211.title: Kicks recognizes you.

choices: You manage to pull yourself back up.
154111222111.content:
Despite knowing that Kicks wants to keep you safe, being buttoned up and not knowing exactly what's going on in the outside world at all times did seem to make you nervous. You attempt to stand in the fabric pocket, before trying to release the button, reaching through the slit of cloth and turning the button, finally barely managing to break it free. You peek up from the pocket, getting a perfect view of the now humongous world you used to live in. Kicks was already pushing his way out of the shop, turning the "OPEN" sign over to "CLOSED", and took a deep breath of fresh air.

Finally, the Skunk made his stride, smiling a little. You could barely be able to see passed his chin, but you could at least tell it was a warm one. You were about to squirm more in the pocket to get a better look around, but a wolf approached the skunk, which made you hide back into the pocket.

"Oh, hey Kicks!" A voice let out. You slowly try to look up, seeing who this new person was.

"--Hey, Lobo. Just closin' up shop right now." The Skunk replied, giving the other a short nod.

"Oh, really? You're closing pretty early."

"Yeah, gotta get home."

"Alright. Hey, we good for coffee tomorrow?"

"Uh-- Sure. I'll be there 'round the time I'm always, chum."

"Okay! See you!" The wolf smiled, waving a paw before heading his way back to town. You couldn't help but lean out a little to watch the other walk away, grasping onto the pocket. Unfortunately, you flip out after leaning to far, but still remain holding onto the pocket. You desperately try to grip onto the cloth, and pull yourself up, but it seems more difficult then it sounds.

You attempt to build your strength back up, trying hard to get back into the pocket with your own upper body strength..
154111222111.title: Head home.

choices: Try to climb back out of Kicks’ overalls
Live out your fantasy and delve deeper into Kicks’ briefs
Before you can do anything, Kicks’ finds you
You fall asleep, the stress being too much for you
1541112221112.content:
Despite your best efforts to pull yourself back up into Kicks’ pocket, when Kicks starts walking again, you immediately lose your grip. You find yourself plummeting downward, the massive field of Kicks’ shirt quickly passing you by. Incredibly, you fall directly into the gap between Kicks’ overalls and his body. You then touch down on a soft cotton surface. Gravity continues to slide you downwards but you manage to clutch the expanse of fabric.Despite the swaying motion that accompanied Kicks’ walking, you manage to keep still. After you get your bearings, you make some observations about this unknown landscape.

Despite being covered in a silky fabric, standing on it is completely possible, meaning that there’s something much more solid underneath. There’s also a very noticeable scent coming off of it. No, not just the fabric. The smell was something much more powerful and it surrounded the entire area and fused itself with the air that you breathed.
It didn’t take you long to realize where you had ended up: Kicks’ cloth covered bulge. Your face turned an intense shade of red yet this realization undeniably aroused you. Being this close to Kicks’ member, being covered in his intense musk, and going along with the swinging motions of Kicks’ gigantic bulge as he walked; you were living out a fantasy!
But what would Kicks say if he finds you this close to his dick and balls? Could you ignore this once-in-a-lifetime sexual experience?
1541112221112.title: Deep divin’

choices: "..Bring ya home, chum.~" (Assistance now, fun later♥)
"..Let you have at it, chum.♥" (Fun now, assistance later~)
15411122211123.content:
All motions from Kicks ceased as he stopped altogether. Uh-oh, had he found you out..? Your question was answered as the fabric of the skunk's overalls was tugged forward by one of his paws, the footwear sales mephit's gaze blinking down at you. "Eh?? How'd you manage t'slip yourself down there, chum?" he asked, head tilting. "An' what're you doing just standin' on my erection for, at that??" Well this situation certainly went from dreamy to awkward in just a few seconds, you'd mentally note..

You figure it's probably better to tell Kicks the truth rather than try to fib your way out of it. Judging by his expression he must know you've got some thoughts on your mind.. So you sigh and confess about your secret fantasy about the cute, attractive footwear-selling skunky, and how you had daydreams about being so close to his rich, mephit meat. You only prayed he would understand and not be upset with you, watching Kicks take in your explanation, blinking a few times.

Finally after what seems like an eternity, but was merely a few moments, Kicks' muzzle drew a short smile on his face. "So you have a soft spot for my skunky dick there, do ya chum?~" your face was flushed red as you nodded silently. "Well then.. How's about this then? I'm gonna.." he began, leaving you tense for his answer, a moment passing before he spoke again..

15431.content:
You awake on a red carpet, head foggy and surrounding area unfamiliar to you at the present minute. Standing up, you notice that you had shrunk to about 2 inches, but not only that, but you recognize the area you are in. You're in the dinosaur section of the museum, and everything starts to flood back. You were admiring the dinosaur collection, when a sudden drowsiness hit you, making you white out.

You decide to try to get someone's help, because the size your at right now, you could be mistaken for a stray bug. You make the run to the main lobby of the museum, which takes you what would be a five second trip five minutes. There, you see Blathers, the caretaker of the museum, sleeping. It must still be day outside, you think, as you go and approach him.

As you approach him though, you stop and think for a second. While Blathers is a nice guy, he is deathly scared of bugs, and with the size you are, he can easily mistake you as one. You do need to get the help of someone though, so you are put in an impasse here. Do you wake Blathers up, or do you let him rest, and find someone else to help?
15431.title: In the museum.

choices: Yep, and you make it to the Observatory.
154312.content:
You definitely don't want to wake him up. You don't really know how he'd react to you, whether that be helping you, or putting you in a case of display, thinking your a new species of insect. It would be too risky, but who to help you...

That's when you notice the upstairs, up to the observatory, and remember Celeste. She would be willing to help you, especially after helping build her the observatory in your recent Public Works Project. All that is worrying you is how are you going to get up there in the first place. Not only do you have to cross the museum lobby, which is occupied by Blathers, but you also have to climb a heaping amount of stairs, which would also be difficult in your size.

You sigh, as you know you got some heavy work ahead of you, as you bolt to the stairs, keeping an eye on the sleeping owl beside you. You're halfway to the stairs when Blathers wakes up, giving of a small "hoooooooo" as he stretches.

To avoid his attention, you begin to walk slowly, making sure that he wont notice you. Question is, does this work?

choices: "Stay right there, and just try to relax. "
1543221.content:
You were groggy, head burning with a strange sensation you were only vaguely aware was a headache. You were visually assaulted with brightness, a sick mixture of blurry white and pink consuming your periphery. You couldn't deal with this much light this second, and close your eyes to dodge the color. With eyesight out of the question, you start to rely on your other senses. A sterile and pure smell around you is split apart by several smells you are only passively aware are perfumes and oils, followed by a far more dominant smell which you can barely grasp as being familiar. It was far more pervasive of a smell, having a quality you could only call "sexual" and a force of surrounding which told you it was coming from a large source. You were on a soft surface, identifying the feeling around you of large, somewhat cylindrical towers. You hear a vague and lilting giggle that seems to come from above. You try opening your eyes again, adjusting to the brightness and facing the sound, only to be confronted with the enormous face, looking straight down at you, who were shorter than her fur on her palm. You were really small.

"Hey there tiny! Looks like you're finally awake!"
1543221.title: In the poodle's palm.

1543222.content: How about the world famous K.K Slider?
1543222.title: Alright then...

15432221.content:
Where are you? The last thing you remember is heading to club LOL to talk to K.K. Slider. But where are you now? You open your eyes halfway ( because that's all you can muster) and try to stand up on the wooden surface that you were lying on. Still groggy, you try lean on the nearest wall. Eventually you find it, but it feels oddly fluffy. Kinda like fur.

"Hey, little man. I see you've finally stopped counting sheep."

A loud voice astonishes you and you look up at the source. You look up to see a gigantic K.K. Slider looming over you. That must mean these furry walls are his fur!
The giant white dog lowers his hand towards you. As he pinched you between his two soft fingers, you noticed that he wasn't holding his guitar like usual, but instead it was lying on the ground next to his stool.

You turn to face K.K. Slider while standing on the palm of his paw.
" Alright, little man, sit back while I give you the details".
K.K. Slider's voice was smooth and gentle but his breath was terrible. Although, you had gotten used to that after living in a town of animals.
"While I was scopin' the venue, I found you lying there. Heck, I almost stepped on you. Then I copped you while the good doctor was catching some z's".
He must mean Dr. Shrunk.
"Point is, I've got a gig comin' up soon and I'm gonna let you decide where I should hide you."

"So, where will it be little man?"
15432221.title: K.K. Giant

154322213.content:
Staring at the giant dog, you considered your options for him to hold you while he did his show. He, like most people (animals?), didn't have clothes. His mouth would be a burdon for him, and could lead to your demise easily. The toes were dangerous too as the well meaning K.K. could crush you.
